column4: I set up my own mail server on linux.  It's not worth it anymore (IMHO) unless it's for a large organization
Why do you say that?
There are too many spam hoops to jump through, and you have to do everything "just right" or your mail can get rejected by some servers.
hmm
Like, having a reverse dns lookup for your IP address is a big gotcha.  A lot of mail servers will drop you if your reverse dns lookup doesn't match the from domain.
That could be bad
And unless you have a hosted environment, a lot of spam blacklists automatically block all dsl and cable IP addresses
And you have to appeal them to get yourself removed
Damn
I enjoyed learning about it, but it is a serious PITA to maintain
Hmm. Is there any alternative to Blackberry Server yet?
For a blackberry?
No for a Treo. What else would a blackberry server do
My wife has a treo, and we bought a Zimbra hosted account.  You can then use exchange activesync to sync mail/contacts/calendar
I was asking if there was a free alternative to Blackberry Server
Otherwise, you can get an IMAP account just about anywhere
Zimbra does push e-mail like blackberry
But there is no "open source blackberry server" that tries to emulate an actual blackberry server
Ah thanks. SOmeone should do that
If you are using a treo, you should seriously look at zimbra.  It works very similarly to a blackberry server
